intro: Aulonix biflorus, commonly known as the two-flowered aulonix, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
